intro: Impatiens macrovexilla, commonly known as the large-veiled impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a range of colors including pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. The flowers are borne on long, slender pedicels and are known for their vibrant color and attractiveness to pollinators.
